name: Dr. Sarah Johnson
bio: Dr. Johnson specializes in cold-weather pet care and has extensive experience treating winter-related conditions in pets. She leads our winter wellness program and has published several papers on hypothermia prevention in domestic animals.
funFact: Has two Siberian Huskies who love snow camping!

name: Dr. Michael Chen
bio: Dr. Chen heads our emergency winter care unit and specializes in treating cold-weather emergencies. He has developed protocols for anti-freeze poisoning treatment and rapid hypothermia response in pets.
funFact: Volunteers with search and rescue dogs during winter storms

name: Dr. Emily Rodriguez
bio: Dr. Rodriguez focuses on winter nutrition and weight management for pets. She creates customized diet plans that help pets maintain optimal health and energy levels during cold months while preventing seasonal weight gain.
funFact: Grows organic vegetables for her three rabbits in indoor winter gardens

name: Dr. James Wilson
bio: With over 15 years of experience, Dr. Wilson specializes in caring for senior pets during winter months. He focuses on arthritis management, joint care, and creating comfortable winter environments for aging pets.
funFact: Has a 17-year-old cat who still enjoys supervised winter balcony time

name: Dr. Amanda Park
bio: Dr. Park helps pets cope with seasonal affective disorder and winter-related anxiety. She develops behavior modification plans and environmental enrichment strategies to keep pets mentally stimulated during indoor months.
funFact: Runs indoor agility classes for dogs during winter months
